goal.ch:
1. Enhance Reading Comprehension: Develop students‘ ability to comprehend and analyse English magazine articles, improving their understanding of various topics and writing styles.


2. Expand Vocabulary: Introduce students to a wide range of vocabulary and idiomatic expressions commonly used in English-language publications, enhancing their language proficiency.


3. Improve Critical Thinking: Encourage critical thinking by analysing the content, structure, and purpose of different articles, fostering the ability to evaluate arguments and viewpoints.


4. Cultural Awareness: Expose students to diverse cultural perspectives and contemporary issues discussed in English-speaking media, broadening their global awareness and cultural understanding.


5. Develop Writing Skills: Enhance students‘ writing abilities by having them summarise articles, write reflections, and create responses, focusing on coherence, clarity, and appropriate use of language.


6. Promote Discussion and Debate: Facilitate class discussions and debates on article topics, promoting oral communication skills and the ability to articulate thoughts and arguments effectively.


7. Foster Independent Learning: Encourage students to independently seek out and read English magazine articles beyond the classroom, fostering a habit of continuous learning and curiosity.


8. Understanding Journalistic Techniques: Teach students to recognise and understand various journalistic techniques and genres, including news reporting, feature writing, opinion pieces, and investigative journalism.


9. Analyse Media Bias and Reliability: Equip students with the skills to identify bias, reliability, and the credibility of sources, promoting media literacy and responsible consumption of information.


10. Enhance Language Communication Skills: Improve students‘ English speaking and writing skills through group collaboration and discussions, boosting their confidence in using the language in various contexts.
goal.en:
1. Enhance Reading Comprehension: Develop students‘ ability to comprehend and analyse English magazine articles, improving their understanding of various topics and writing styles.

2. Expand Vocabulary: Introduce students to a wide range of vocabulary and idiomatic expressions commonly used in English-language publications, enhancing their language proficiency.

3. Improve Critical Thinking: Encourage critical thinking by analysing the content, structure, and purpose of different articles, fostering the ability to evaluate arguments and viewpoints.

4. Cultural Awareness: Expose students to diverse cultural perspectives and contemporary issues discussed in English-speaking media, broadening their global awareness and cultural understanding.

5. Develop Writing Skills: Enhance students‘ writing abilities by having them summarise articles, write reflections, and create responses, focusing on coherence, clarity, and appropriate use of language.

6. Promote Discussion and Debate: Facilitate class discussions and debates on article topics, promoting oral communication skills and the ability to articulate thoughts and arguments effectively.

7. Foster Independent Learning: Encourage students to independently seek out and read English magazine articles beyond the classroom, fostering a habit of continuous learning and curiosity.

8. Understanding Journalistic Techniques: Teach students to recognise and understand various journalistic techniques and genres, including news reporting, feature writing, opinion pieces, and investigative journalism.

9. Analyse Media Bias and Reliability: Equip students with the skills to identify bias, reliability, and the credibility of sources, promoting media literacy and responsible consumption of information.

10. Enhance Language Communication Skills: Improve students‘ English speaking and writing skills through group collaboration and discussions, boosting their confidence in using the language in various contexts.

1. 提升閱讀理解：培養學生理解和分析英語雜誌文章的能力，提高他們對各種主題和寫作風格的理解。

2. 擴展詞彙量：介紹學生廣泛的詞彙和慣用語，提高他們的語言熟練度。

3. 增強批判思維：通過分析不同文章的內容、結構和目的，鼓勵批判性思維，培養評估論點和觀點的能力。

4. 提高文化認知：讓學生接觸到英語媒體中討論的不同文化視角和當代問題，擴大他們的全球視野和文化理解。

5. 發展寫作技巧：提高學生的寫作能力，讓他們撰寫文章摘要、反思和回應，注重連貫性、清晰度和語言的適當使用。

6. 促進討論和辯論：在課堂上進行文章主題討論和辯論，提升口語交流技巧和有效表達思想和論點的能力。

7. 培養自主學習：鼓勵學生在課堂之外自主尋找和閱讀英語雜誌文章，培養持續學習和好奇心的習慣。

8. 理解新聞技術：教導學生識別和理解各種新聞技術和體裁，包括新聞報導、特寫寫作、評論文章和調查報導。

9. 分析媒體偏見和可靠性：培養學生識別偏見、評估來源可靠性和可信度的能力，提高媒體素養和負責任的信息消費。

10. 增進語言交流能力：透過小組合作和討論，增進學生的英語口語和書面交流能力，提升他們在各種情境下的語言運用自信心。

outline.ch:
This course will be fun and practical. We will examine the features of English magazines and read various types of magazines. Additionally, we will participate in hands-on activities, including the creation of our own magazine.
Tentative Syllabus
Week 1: Course Introduction and Magazine Style Overview
•Topics:
oCourse objectives and expectations
oIntroduction to various magazine styles (news, lifestyle, scientific, etc.)
•Activities:
oIcebreaker activities
oOverview of course materials and resources
Week 2: News Magazines
•Magazine Style: News
•Examples: Time, The Economist
•Topics:
oNews reporting techniques
oObjective vs. subjective reporting
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oVocabulary and comprehension exercises
Week 3: Lifestyle Magazines
•Magazine Style: Lifestyle
•Examples: Vogue, GQ
•Topics:
oFeatures and trends in lifestyle journalism
oAnalysis of visual and textual elements
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a short lifestyle feature
Week 4: Scientific Magazines
•Magazine Style: Scientific
•Examples: National Geographic, Scientific American
•Topics:
oPresentation of scientific research and discoveries
oSimplifying complex information for a general audience
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oSummarising a scientific article
Week 5: Business Magazines
•Magazine Style: Business
•Examples: Forbes, Bloomberg Businessweek
•Topics:
oBusiness reporting and financial journalism
oProfiles of companies and leaders
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a business news report
Week 6: Travel Magazines
•Magazine Style: Travel
•Examples: Condé Nast Traveler, Travel + Leisure
•Topics:
oDescriptive writing and travel narratives
oCultural insights and destination highlights
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oCreating a travel itinerary and article
Week 7: Entertainment Magazines
•Magazine Style: Entertainment
•Examples: Entertainment Weekly, Rolling Stone
•Topics:
oCoverage of entertainment news and celebrity culture
oReviews and feature stories
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a movie or music review
Week 8: Health and Fitness Magazines
•Magazine Style: Health and Fitness
•Examples: Men‘s Health, Women‘s Health
•Topics:
oHealth tips, fitness regimes, and wellness trends
oEvaluating the reliability of health information
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oCreating a personal health and fitness plan
Week 9: Technology Magazines
•Magazine Style: Technology
•Examples: Wired, TechCrunch
•Topics:
oReporting on technological advancements and innovations
oImpact of technology on society
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a tech product review
Week 10: Fashion Magazines
•Magazine Style: Fashion
•Examples: Elle, Harper‘s Bazaar
•Topics:
oTrends in fashion journalism
oAnalysis of fashion editorials
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oDesigning a fashion editorial
Week 11: Food and Beverage Magazines
•Magazine Style: Food and Beverage
•Examples: Bon Appétit, Food ＆ Wine
•Topics:
oCulinary journalism and food photography
oRecipe writing and restaurant reviews
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a restaurant review or recipe
Week 12: Art and Culture Magazines
•Magazine Style: Art and Culture
•Examples: Artforum, The Atlantic
•Topics:
oCoverage of art exhibitions, literature, and cultural events
oCritical analysis and reviews
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a cultural critique
Week 13: Political Magazines
•Magazine Style: Political
•Examples: The New Yorker, Foreign Affairs
•Topics:
oIn-depth political analysis and commentary
oBias and perspective in political reporting
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oDebating a current political issue
Week 14: Environmental Magazines
•Magazine Style: Environmental
•Examples: Sierra, Earth Island Journal
•Topics:
oEnvironmental issues and advocacy
oReporting on sustainability and conservation
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting an environmental impact article
Week 15: Sports Magazines
•Magazine Style: Sports
•Examples: Sports Illustrated, ESPN Magazine
•Topics:
oSports journalism and athlete profiles
oEvent coverage and analysis
•Activities:
oReading and discussing selected articles
oWriting a sports event report
Week 16: Group Presentations and Final Assessment
•Activities:
oGroup presentations on selected magazine articles
oFinal assessment (written and/or oral)
oCourse wrap-up and feedback session
